definition: variant of 門檻|门槛[men2 kan3]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: One of our themes is to lower the barriers to entry.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一个主旨，就是降低入门的门坎。

sentences.english: In 1906, missionary Pev and Mrs Harry Parsons brought potato into this area.
sentences.chinese: 1906年，传教士张道惠夫人将洋芋引入石门坎。

sentences.english: At the threshold of the 21th century, the age of knowledge-economy is making for us.
sentences.chinese: 站在21世纪的门坎，知识经济时代正向我们走来。

sentences.english: The corn of God's floor must expect to be threshed by afflictions and persecutions.
sentences.chinese: 上帝屋内地板的一角必是苦难与逼迫的门坎。

sentences.english: This night, is the first walked into a los harp sea of book or reduced.
sentences.chinese: 这一晚，是京洛最初一次走进琴海书寓的门坎。

sentences.english: Whosoever enters through the portals of this home must go out with gladsome heart.
sentences.chinese: 不管谁步入这家的门坎，他将带着一颗开心的心归去。
